unit_learning_outcomes.description: Describe key components of classroom management for effective learning.
Apply understanding of educational assessment in a variety of ways that inform and enhance pedagogy.
Plan for classroom management, taking into account the theoretical bases of behaviour and knowledge approaches.
Plan for and implement effective teaching for the relevant teaching subject(s).
Describe and explain key concepts of educational assessment.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparing for the lectures, tutorials, and school placement

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp at 1000 level or above including  EDST2999 and (EDST200 or EDST2000)

assessments.description: Students are given an assessment for learning task which they critique in light of their professional experience and relevant educational literature.

assessments.assessment_title: Supervising Teacher Report and Register of Visits
assessments.description: The final professional experience report form completed by the supervising teacher and the register which shows the dates attended at the school and activities undertaken by the student.
Students analyse a classroom management incident and critique it through analysis of relevant literature

data.subject_search_title: EDST3010 - Practice of Teaching: Classroom Management and Assessment in the Secondary School
data.description: This unit is a Professional Experience unit for intending secondary school teachers. Students are required to work in a school for 10 days under the guidance of a Supervising Teacher implementing the strategies and techniques being developed concurrently in the unit. Lectures and tutorials focus on developing students' knowledge and skills for managing school students' behaviour and the principles of assessment and reporting.
